hashtag#hiring hashtag#javadeveloper hashtag#canadianworkauthorizationJob Title: Java Full Stack DeveloperLocation: Montreal, QC (Hybrid)Experience: 7+ YearsValid Canadian work authorizationAbout the Role:We are seeking a Senior Java Full Stack Developer with strong expertise in Java-based server-side development and modern JavaScript frameworks for front-end development. The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing, building, and optimizing high-performance, scalable, and secure applications in a collaborative Agile environment. Key Responsibilities:Backend Development: Design and develop high-performance, low-latency applications using Java 8+, Spring Boot, and RESTful APIs.Build and maintain microservices-based architectures for scalable enterprise solutions.Optimize database queries for PostgreSQL, DB2, Oracle, or similar relational databases. Frontend Development: Develop responsive and interactive UI components using React.js, Angular, or Vue.js.Implement modern UI/UX practices with HTML5, CSS3, and Bootstrap. Collaboration & Agile Development: Work with architects, business analysts, and developers across global teams to deliver robust end-to-end solutions.Participate in Agile ceremonies such as sprint planning, retrospectives, and daily stand-ups.Conduct code reviews, unit testing, and integration testing to maintain high code quality. DevOps & Security: Enhance and maintain CI/CD pipelines for continuous integration and delivery.Ensure applications adhere to security best practices, scalability, and compliance standards.Monitor production environments, troubleshoot issues, and implement sustainable solutions. Required Skills & Experience:Backend: Java 8+ | Spring Boot | REST APIs | MicroservicesFrontend: JavaScript | TypeScript | React.js | Angular | Vue.js | HTML5 | CSS3 | BootstrapDatabases: PostgreSQL | DB2 | Oracle (Experience with writing optimized queries)Version Control & Build Tools: Git | Maven | GradleAgile Development: Experience with JIRA & ConfluenceExcellent Communication & Teamwork: Ability to collaborate in a globally distributed team Nice to Have (Preferred Skills):NoSQL Databases: Experience with MongoDB or other NoSQL solutionsCloud Technologies: Exposure to Azure (or other cloud platforms)DevOps & Containers: Experience with Docker/Kubernetes, Jenkins, GitLab CIMessaging & Security: Familiarity with Kafka, OAuth2/JWT, Enterprise Security ModelsPerformance Optimization: Strong understanding of memory management and performance tuning for enterprise applicationsEligible candidates can email to shua.ahmed@cbwci.ca

🌟 Job Title: Full-Time Tech Roles - OPT-EAD & H1-B Visa Talent, This Is YOUR Moment! 🌟🚀 We’re thrilled to unveil game-changing tech opportunities across the USA! Our top-tier recruitment firm is searching for brilliant OPT-EAD and H1-B visa holders ready to skyrocket their careers with industry leaders. If you’ve got the skills and the drive, we’ve got the stage!🔥 Hot Tech Roles Up for Grabs:- Software Developers (Master Java, Python, JavaScript, or beyond!)- Data Analysts & Data Scientists (Turn numbers into magic!)- DevOps Engineers (Build the backbone of innovation!)- Cloud Solutions Architects (Shape the future of tech!)- Cybersecurity Specialists (Defend the digital frontier!)- QA Engineers (Perfect the products that matter!)💡 What You Bring to the Table:- A degree in Computer Science, IT, or a related field (your foundation).- Real-world experience in development, data, or IT support (your proof).- Killer problem-solving skills and a passion for tech (your spark).- Comfort with cutting-edge tools and methods (your edge).🎉 Why You’ll Love Working With Us:Join a recruitment powerhouse that connects you—the tech elite—with the biggest names in the game. 🚀 Why OpenShift Is More Than Just Kubernetes — It’s Enterprise KubernetesKubernetes is powerful, but OpenShift brings the enterprise-grade muscle it needs to run securely, reliably, and at scale.Whether you're modernizing legacy apps, building cloud-native microservices, or implementing hybrid cloud strategies — Red Hat OpenShift is becoming the platform of choice.🔧 What Makes OpenShift Unique?✅ Built-in CI/CD pipelines (Tekton + ArgoCD) ✅ Developer self-service with guardrails ✅ Integrated security – SSO, RBAC, container image scanning ✅ Hybrid & Multi-cloud Ready – AWS, Azure, GCP, VMware, Bare Metal ✅ Operator Framework – Automate Day 2 operations with ease ✅ OpenShift Service Mesh – Built-in observability with Istio, Jaeger, and Kiali🔁 It's not just about containers — it's about lifecycle.From build to deploy to monitor — OpenShift manages the full DevOps lifecycle in a unified, production-ready environment.“Kubernetes is the engine. OpenShift is the vehicle that gets you to production safely.”💡 Are you running OpenShift? Or considering it over vanilla Kubernetes? 🚀 Why OpenShift Is More Than Just Kubernetes — It’s Enterprise KubernetesKubernetes is powerful, but OpenShift brings the enterprise-grade muscle it needs to run securely, reliably, and at scale.Whether you're modernizing legacy apps, building cloud-native microservices, or implementing hybrid cloud strategies — Red Hat OpenShift is becoming the platform of choice.🔧 What Makes OpenShift Unique?✅ Built-in CI/CD pipelines (Tekton + ArgoCD) ✅ Developer self-service with guardrails ✅ Integrated security – SSO, RBAC, container image scanning ✅ Hybrid & Multi-cloud Ready – AWS, Azure, GCP, VMware, Bare Metal ✅ Operator Framework – Automate Day 2 operations with ease ✅ OpenShift Service Mesh – Built-in observability with Istio, Jaeger, and Kiali🔁 It's not just about containers — it's about lifecycle.From build to deploy to monitor — OpenShift manages the full DevOps lifecycle in a unified, production-ready environment.“Kubernetes is the engine. OpenShift is the vehicle that gets you to production safely.”💡 Are you running OpenShift? Or considering it over vanilla Kubernetes? Drop your experience or questions below — let’s connect and share knowledge! 👇hashtag#OpenShift hashtag#RedHat hashtag#Kubernetes hashtag#DevOps hashtag#HybridCloud hashtag#CloudNative hashtag#Containers hashtag#PlatformEngineering hashtag#SRE hashtag#CloudComputing hashtag#DeveloperExperience hashtag#CICD hashtag#Istio hashtag#Java hashtag#Cloud hashtag#AWS hashtag#Azure hashtag#infrastructure hashtag#Site hashtag#ArgoCD hashtag#OpenToWork hashtag#C2C hashtag#EngineeringExcellence hashtag#Hiring hashtag#EnterpriseCloud hashtag#AIinProduction hashtag#TechLeadership hashtag#InfrastructureAutomation

hashtag#hiring hashtag#javadeveloper hashtag#canadianworkauthorizationJob Title: Java Full Stack DeveloperLocation: Montreal, QC (Hybrid)Experience: 7+ YearsValid Canadian work authorizationAbout the Role:We are seeking a Senior Java Full Stack Developer with strong expertise in Java-based server-side development and modern JavaScript frameworks for front-end development. The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing, building, and optimizing high-performance, scalable, and secure applications in a collaborative Agile environment. Key Responsibilities:Backend Development: Design and develop high-performance, low-latency applications using Java 8+, Spring Boot, and RESTful APIs.Build and maintain microservices-based architectures for scalable enterprise solutions.Optimize database queries for PostgreSQL, DB2, Oracle, or similar relational databases. Frontend Development: Develop responsive and interactive UI components using React.js, Angular, or Vue.js.Implement modern UI/UX practices with HTML5, CSS3, and Bootstrap. Collaboration & Agile Development: Work with architects, business analysts, and developers across global teams to deliver robust end-to-end solutions.Participate in Agile ceremonies such as sprint planning, retrospectives, and daily stand-ups.Conduct code reviews, unit testing, and integration testing to maintain high code quality. DevOps & Security: Enhance and maintain CI/CD pipelines for continuous integration and delivery.Ensure applications adhere to security best practices, scalability, and compliance standards.Monitor production environments, troubleshoot issues, and implement sustainable solutions. Required Skills & Experience:Backend: Java 8+ | Spring Boot | REST APIs | MicroservicesFrontend: JavaScript | TypeScript | React.js | Angular | Vue.js | HTML5 | CSS3 | BootstrapDatabases: PostgreSQL | DB2 | Oracle (Experience with writing optimized queries)Version Control & Build Tools: Git | Maven | GradleAgile Development: Experience with JIRA & ConfluenceExcellent Communication & Teamwork: Ability to collaborate in a globally distributed team Nice to Have (Preferred Skills):NoSQL Databases: Experience with MongoDB or other NoSQL solutionsCloud Technologies: Exposure to Azure (or other cloud platforms)DevOps & Containers: Experience with Docker/Kubernetes, Jenkins, GitLab CIMessaging & Security: Familiarity with Kafka, OAuth2/JWT, Enterprise Security ModelsPerformance Optimization: Strong understanding of memory management and performance tuning for enterprise applicationsEligible candidates can email to shua.ahmed@cbwci.ca

hashtag#hiring hashtag#javadeveloper hashtag#canadianworkauthorizationJob Title: Java Full Stack DeveloperLocation: Montreal, QC (Hybrid)Experience: 7+ YearsValid Canadian work authorizationAbout the Role:We are seeking a Senior Java Full Stack Developer with strong expertise in Java-based server-side development and modern JavaScript frameworks for front-end development. The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing, building, and optimizing high-performance, scalable, and secure applications in a collaborative Agile environment. Key Responsibilities:Backend Development: Design and develop high-performance, low-latency applications using Java 8+, Spring Boot, and RESTful APIs.Build and maintain microservices-based architectures for scalable enterprise solutions.Optimize database queries for PostgreSQL, DB2, Oracle, or similar relational databases. DevOps & Security: Enhance and maintain CI/CD pipelines for continuous integration and delivery.Ensure applications adhere to security best practices, scalability, and compliance standards.Monitor production environments, troubleshoot issues, and implement sustainable solutions. Required Skills & Experience:Backend: Java 8+ | Spring Boot | REST APIs | MicroservicesFrontend: JavaScript | TypeScript | React.js | Angular | Vue.js | HTML5 | CSS3 | BootstrapDatabases: PostgreSQL | DB2 | Oracle (Experience with writing optimized queries)Version Control & Build Tools: Git | Maven | GradleAgile Development: Experience with JIRA & ConfluenceExcellent Communication & Teamwork: Ability to collaborate in a globally distributed team Nice to Have (Preferred Skills):NoSQL Databases: Experience with MongoDB or other NoSQL solutionsCloud Technologies: Exposure to Azure (or other cloud platforms)DevOps & Containers: Experience with Docker/Kubernetes, Jenkins, GitLab CIMessaging & Security: Familiarity with Kafka, OAuth2/JWT, Enterprise Security ModelsPerformance Optimization: Strong understanding of memory management and performance tuning for enterprise applicationsEligible candidates can email to shua.ahmed@cbwci.ca

🚀 Why OpenShift Is More Than Just Kubernetes — It’s Enterprise KubernetesKubernetes is powerful, but OpenShift brings the enterprise-grade muscle it needs to run securely, reliably, and at scale.Whether you're modernizing legacy apps, building cloud-native microservices, or implementing hybrid cloud strategies — Red Hat OpenShift is becoming the platform of choice.🔧 What Makes OpenShift Unique?✅ Built-in CI/CD pipelines (Tekton + ArgoCD) ✅ Developer self-service with guardrails ✅ Integrated security – SSO, RBAC, container image scanning ✅ Hybrid & Multi-cloud Ready – AWS, Azure, GCP, VMware, Bare Metal ✅ Operator Framework – Automate Day 2 operations with ease ✅ OpenShift Service Mesh – Built-in observability with Istio, Jaeger, and Kiali🔁 It's not just about containers — it's about lifecycle.From build to deploy to monitor — OpenShift manages the full DevOps lifecycle in a unified, production-ready environment.“Kubernetes is the engine. OpenShift is the vehicle that gets you to production safely.”💡 Are you running OpenShift? Or considering it over vanilla Kubernetes? 🚀 Why OpenShift Is More Than Just Kubernetes — It’s Enterprise KubernetesKubernetes is powerful, but OpenShift brings the enterprise-grade muscle it needs to run securely, reliably, and at scale.Whether you're modernizing legacy apps, building cloud-native microservices, or implementing hybrid cloud strategies — Red Hat OpenShift is becoming the platform of choice.🔧 What Makes OpenShift Unique?✅ Built-in CI/CD pipelines (Tekton + ArgoCD) ✅ Developer self-service with guardrails ✅ Integrated security – SSO, RBAC, container image scanning ✅ Hybrid & Multi-cloud Ready – AWS, Azure, GCP, VMware, Bare Metal ✅ Operator Framework – Automate Day 2 operations with ease ✅ OpenShift Service Mesh – Built-in observability with Istio, Jaeger, and Kiali🔁 It's not just about containers — it's about lifecycle.From build to deploy to monitor — OpenShift manages the full DevOps lifecycle in a unified, production-ready environment.“Kubernetes is the engine. OpenShift is the vehicle that gets you to production safely.”💡 Are you running OpenShift? Or considering it over vanilla Kubernetes? 🚀 Why OpenShift Is More Than Just Kubernetes — It’s Enterprise KubernetesKubernetes is powerful, but OpenShift brings the enterprise-grade muscle it needs to run securely, reliably, and at scale.Whether you're modernizing legacy apps, building cloud-native microservices, or implementing hybrid cloud strategies — Red Hat OpenShift is becoming the platform of choice.🔧 What Makes OpenShift Unique?✅ Built-in CI/CD pipelines (Tekton + ArgoCD) ✅ Developer self-service with guardrails ✅ Integrated security – SSO, RBAC, container image scanning ✅ Hybrid & Multi-cloud Ready – AWS, Azure, GCP, VMware, Bare Metal ✅ Operator Framework – Automate Day 2 operations with ease ✅ OpenShift Service Mesh – Built-in observability with Istio, Jaeger, and Kiali🔁 It's not just about containers — it's about lifecycle.From build to deploy to monitor — OpenShift manages the full DevOps lifecycle in a unified, production-ready environment.“Kubernetes is the engine. OpenShift is the vehicle that gets you to production safely.”💡 Are you running OpenShift? Or considering it over vanilla Kubernetes? Exciting New Chapter Ahead – Open to Full Stack Developer Roles!After an incredible journey working on building scalable applications, leading development teams, and solving complex tech challenges, I’m now looking for my next opportunity as a Full Stack Developer!Over the past four years, I’ve had the chance to work on some amazing projects—transitioning monolithic applications to microservices, optimizing cloud deployments with AWS, and building smooth, user-friendly interfaces with React.js. I thrive in environments where I can tackle backend challenges with Java & Spring Boot while also crafting seamless front-end experiences.At my last role with Folderwave in Boston, I led a team of developers through a large-scale architectural shift, enhancing scalability and doubling feature release velocity. There’s something incredibly fulfilling about seeing a project come to life and knowing you played a key role in making it happen.Now, I’m looking for a new opportunity where I can bring my skills, learn from brilliant minds, and continue pushing the boundaries of what’s possible with technology. If you’re hiring or know of a team that could use an enthusiastic, problem-solving Full Stack Developer, let’s connect!Boston, MA | Open to Remote, Relocation & On-site Roles Tech Stack: Java | Spring Boot | React.js | AWS | Microservices | Docker | KubernetesI’d love to chat—drop me a message or feel free to tag someone who might be interested. 🚀 Why OpenShift Is More Than Just Kubernetes — It’s Enterprise KubernetesKubernetes is powerful, but OpenShift brings the enterprise-grade muscle it needs to run securely, reliably, and at scale.Whether you're modernizing legacy apps, building cloud-native microservices, or implementing hybrid cloud strategies — Red Hat OpenShift is becoming the platform of choice.🔧 What Makes OpenShift Unique?✅ Built-in CI/CD pipelines (Tekton + ArgoCD) ✅ Developer self-service with guardrails ✅ Integrated security – SSO, RBAC, container image scanning ✅ Hybrid & Multi-cloud Ready – AWS, Azure, GCP, VMware, Bare Metal ✅ Operator Framework – Automate Day 2 operations with ease ✅ OpenShift Service Mesh – Built-in observability with Istio, Jaeger, and Kiali🔁 It's not just about containers — it's about lifecycle.From build to deploy to monitor — OpenShift manages the full DevOps lifecycle in a unified, production-ready environment.“Kubernetes is the engine. OpenShift is the vehicle that gets you to production safely.”💡 Are you running OpenShift? Or considering it over vanilla Kubernetes? 🚀 Why OpenShift Is More Than Just Kubernetes — It’s Enterprise KubernetesKubernetes is powerful, but OpenShift brings the enterprise-grade muscle it needs to run securely, reliably, and at scale.Whether you're modernizing legacy apps, building cloud-native microservices, or implementing hybrid cloud strategies — Red Hat OpenShift is becoming the platform of choice.🔧 What Makes OpenShift Unique?✅ Built-in CI/CD pipelines (Tekton + ArgoCD) ✅ Developer self-service with guardrails ✅ Integrated security – SSO, RBAC, container image scanning ✅ Hybrid & Multi-cloud Ready – AWS, Azure, GCP, VMware, Bare Metal ✅ Operator Framework – Automate Day 2 operations with ease ✅ OpenShift Service Mesh – Built-in observability with Istio, Jaeger, and Kiali🔁 It's not just about containers — it's about lifecycle.From build to deploy to monitor — OpenShift manages the full DevOps lifecycle in a unified, production-ready environment.“Kubernetes is the engine. OpenShift is the vehicle that gets you to production safely.”💡 Are you running OpenShift? Or considering it over vanilla Kubernetes? hashtag#hiring hashtag#javadeveloper hashtag#canadianworkauthorizationJob Title: Java Full Stack DeveloperLocation: Montreal, QC (Hybrid)Experience: 7+ YearsValid Canadian work authorizationAbout the Role:We are seeking a Senior Java Full Stack Developer with strong expertise in Java-based server-side development and modern JavaScript frameworks for front-end development. The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing, building, and optimizing high-performance, scalable, and secure applications in a collaborative Agile environment. Key Responsibilities:Backend Development: Design and develop high-performance, low-latency applications using Java 8+, Spring Boot, and RESTful APIs.Build and maintain microservices-based architectures for scalable enterprise solutions.Optimize database queries for PostgreSQL, DB2, Oracle, or similar relational databases. Frontend Development: Develop responsive and interactive UI components using React.js, Angular, or Vue.js.Implement modern UI/UX practices with HTML5, CSS3, and Bootstrap. Collaboration & Agile Development: Work with architects, business analysts, and developers across global teams to deliver robust end-to-end solutions.Participate in Agile ceremonies such as sprint planning, retrospectives, and daily stand-ups.Conduct code reviews, unit testing, and integration testing to maintain high code quality. DevOps & Security: Enhance and maintain CI/CD pipelines for continuous integration and delivery.Ensure applications adhere to security best practices, scalability, and compliance standards.Monitor production environments, troubleshoot issues, and implement sustainable solutions. Required Skills & Experience:Backend: Java 8+ | Spring Boot | REST APIs | MicroservicesFrontend: JavaScript | TypeScript | React.js | Angular | Vue.js | HTML5 | CSS3 | BootstrapDatabases: PostgreSQL | DB2 | Oracle (Experience with writing optimized queries)Version Control & Build Tools: Git | Maven | GradleAgile Development: Experience with JIRA & ConfluenceExcellent Communication & Teamwork: Ability to collaborate in a globally distributed team Nice to Have (Preferred Skills):NoSQL Databases: Experience with MongoDB or other NoSQL solutionsCloud Technologies: Exposure to Azure (or other cloud platforms)DevOps & Containers: Experience with Docker/Kubernetes, Jenkins, GitLab CIMessaging & Security: Familiarity with Kafka, OAuth2/JWT, Enterprise Security ModelsPerformance Optimization: Strong understanding of memory management and performance tuning for enterprise applicationsEligible candidates can email to shua.ahmed@cbwci.ca

Exciting New Chapter Ahead – Open to Full Stack Developer Roles!After an incredible journey working on building scalable applications, leading development teams, and solving complex tech challenges, I’m now looking for my next opportunity as a Full Stack Developer!Over the past four years, I’ve had the chance to work on some amazing projects—transitioning monolithic applications to microservices, optimizing cloud deployments with AWS, and building smooth, user-friendly interfaces with React.js. There’s something incredibly fulfilling about seeing a project come to life and knowing you played a key role in making it happen.Now, I’m looking for a new opportunity where I can bring my skills, learn from brilliant minds, and continue pushing the boundaries of what’s possible with technology. 🚀 Why OpenShift Is More Than Just Kubernetes — It’s Enterprise KubernetesKubernetes is powerful, but OpenShift brings the enterprise-grade muscle it needs to run securely, reliably, and at scale.Whether you're modernizing legacy apps, building cloud-native microservices, or implementing hybrid cloud strategies — Red Hat OpenShift is becoming the platform of choice.🔧 What Makes OpenShift Unique?✅ Built-in CI/CD pipelines (Tekton + ArgoCD) ✅ Developer self-service with guardrails ✅ Integrated security – SSO, RBAC, container image scanning ✅ Hybrid & Multi-cloud Ready – AWS, Azure, GCP, VMware, Bare Metal ✅ Operator Framework – Automate Day 2 operations with ease ✅ OpenShift Service Mesh – Built-in observability with Istio, Jaeger, and Kiali🔁 It's not just about containers — it's about lifecycle.From build to deploy to monitor — OpenShift manages the full DevOps lifecycle in a unified, production-ready environment.“Kubernetes is the engine. OpenShift is the vehicle that gets you to production safely.”💡 Are you running OpenShift? Or considering it over vanilla Kubernetes? Drop your experience or questions below — let’s connect and share knowledge! 👇hashtag#OpenShift hashtag#RedHat hashtag#Kubernetes hashtag#DevOps hashtag#HybridCloud hashtag#CloudNative hashtag#Containers hashtag#PlatformEngineering hashtag#SRE hashtag#CloudComputing hashtag#DeveloperExperience hashtag#CICD hashtag#Istio hashtag#Java hashtag#Cloud hashtag#AWS hashtag#Azure hashtag#infrastructure hashtag#Site hashtag#ArgoCD hashtag#OpenToWork hashtag#C2C hashtag#EngineeringExcellence hashtag#Hiring hashtag#EnterpriseCloud hashtag#AIinProduction hashtag#TechLeadership hashtag#InfrastructureAutomation

Exciting New Chapter Ahead – Open to Full Stack Developer Roles!After an incredible journey working on building scalable applications, leading development teams, and solving complex tech challenges, I’m now looking for my next opportunity as a Full Stack Developer!Over the past four years, I’ve had the chance to work on some amazing projects—transitioning monolithic applications to microservices, optimizing cloud deployments with AWS, and building smooth, user-friendly interfaces with React.js. I thrive in environments where I can tackle backend challenges with Java & Spring Boot while also crafting seamless front-end experiences.At my last role with Folderwave in Boston, I led a team of developers through a large-scale architectural shift, enhancing scalability and doubling feature release velocity. There’s something incredibly fulfilling about seeing a project come to life and knowing you played a key role in making it happen.Now, I’m looking for a new opportunity where I can bring my skills, learn from brilliant minds, and continue pushing the boundaries of what’s possible with technology. If you’re hiring or know of a team that could use an enthusiastic, problem-solving Full Stack Developer, let’s connect!Boston, MA | Open to Remote, Relocation & On-site Roles Tech Stack: Java | Spring Boot | React.js | AWS | Microservices | Docker | KubernetesI’d love to chat—drop me a message or feel free to tag someone who might be interested. "You're spending time to save money when you should be spending money to save time." - 𝗡𝗮𝘃𝗮𝗹 𝗥𝗮𝘃𝗶𝗸𝗮𝗻𝘁*Securing a job in the USA as an international student is no small feat, but it’s entirely possible with the right approach and mindset. The job market is competitive, but you have a unique set of skills and perspectives that can be valuable to employers. By strategically leveraging your resources, networking, and continuously improving your skills, you can position yourself for success.*Remember that job hunting is a process, and it often takes time. Rejections are normal, especially in the beginning. They don’t define your capabilities or your potential. Each step you take brings you closer to your goal. Stay persistent and adapt your approach as you learn more about the industry, the hiring process, and your personal strengths. *The key to success lies in your willingness to invest in yourself—whether it's through networking, learning new skills, or getting professional help with your job applications and interviews. As Naval Ravikant emphasizes, sometimes spending money to save time can accelerate your progress. Whether you invest in career coaching, networking events, or online courses, these investments can give you a competitive edge in a crowded job market.*Lastly, don’t forget to enjoy the process. The journey to securing a job is also an opportunity to learn about different industries, build relationships, and understand your own career goals. Embrace the challenges as they come, and remember that persistence, adaptability, and continuous learning are your best assets.You're not just searching for any job—you're building a foundation for your career in the U.S. Stay focused, stay strategic, and stay confident. The job you’re aiming for is within reach, and your persistence and preparation will make all the difference.Good luck with your job search! 🚀 Why OpenShift Is More Than Just Kubernetes — It’s Enterprise KubernetesKubernetes is powerful, but OpenShift brings the enterprise-grade muscle it needs to run securely, reliably, and at scale.Whether you're modernizing legacy apps, building cloud-native microservices, or implementing hybrid cloud strategies — Red Hat OpenShift is becoming the platform of choice.🔧 What Makes OpenShift Unique?✅ Built-in CI/CD pipelines (Tekton + ArgoCD) ✅ Developer self-service with guardrails ✅ Integrated security – SSO, RBAC, container image scanning ✅ Hybrid & Multi-cloud Ready – AWS, Azure, GCP, VMware, Bare Metal ✅ Operator Framework – Automate Day 2 operations with ease ✅ OpenShift Service Mesh – Built-in observability with Istio, Jaeger, and Kiali🔁 It's not just about containers — it's about lifecycle.From build to deploy to monitor — OpenShift manages the full DevOps lifecycle in a unified, production-ready environment.“Kubernetes is the engine. OpenShift is the vehicle that gets you to production safely.”💡 Are you running OpenShift? Or considering it over vanilla Kubernetes? "You're spending time to save money when you should be spending money to save time." - 𝗡𝗮𝘃𝗮𝗹 𝗥𝗮𝘃𝗶𝗸𝗮𝗻𝘁*Securing a job in the USA as an international student is no small feat, but it’s entirely possible with the right approach and mindset. The job market is competitive, but you have a unique set of skills and perspectives that can be valuable to employers. By strategically leveraging your resources, networking, and continuously improving your skills, you can position yourself for success.*Remember that job hunting is a process, and it often takes time. Rejections are normal, especially in the beginning. They don’t define your capabilities or your potential. Each step you take brings you closer to your goal. Stay persistent and adapt your approach as you learn more about the industry, the hiring process, and your personal strengths. *The key to success lies in your willingness to invest in yourself—whether it's through networking, learning new skills, or getting professional help with your job applications and interviews. As Naval Ravikant emphasizes, sometimes spending money to save time can accelerate your progress. Whether you invest in career coaching, networking events, or online courses, these investments can give you a competitive edge in a crowded job market.*Lastly, don’t forget to enjoy the process. The journey to securing a job is also an opportunity to learn about different industries, build relationships, and understand your own career goals. Embrace the challenges as they come, and remember that persistence, adaptability, and continuous learning are your best assets.You're not just searching for any job—you're building a foundation for your career in the U.S. Stay focused, stay strategic, and stay confident. The job you’re aiming for is within reach, and your persistence and preparation will make all the difference.Good luck with your job search! Username: Siva Sai Manoj K.Siva Sai Manoj K.
Post Content:
🚀 Why OpenShift Is More Than Just Kubernetes — It’s Enterprise KubernetesKubernetes is powerful, but OpenShift brings the enterprise-grade muscle it needs to run securely, reliably, and at scale.Whether you're modernizing legacy apps, building cloud-native microservices, or implementing hybrid cloud strategies — Red Hat OpenShift is becoming the platform of choice.🔧 What Makes OpenShift Unique?✅ Built-in CI/CD pipelines (Tekton + ArgoCD) ✅ Developer self-service with guardrails ✅ Integrated security – SSO, RBAC, container image scanning ✅ Hybrid & Multi-cloud Ready – AWS, Azure, GCP, VMware, Bare Metal ✅ Operator Framework – Automate Day 2 operations with ease ✅ OpenShift Service Mesh – Built-in observability with Istio, Jaeger, and Kiali🔁 It's not just about containers — it's about lifecycle.From build to deploy to monitor — OpenShift manages the full DevOps lifecycle in a unified, production-ready environment.“Kubernetes is the engine. OpenShift is the vehicle that gets you to production safely.”💡 Are you running OpenShift? Or considering it over vanilla Kubernetes? Drop your experience or questions below — let’s connect and share knowledge! 👇hashtag#OpenShift hashtag#RedHat hashtag#Kubernetes hashtag#DevOps hashtag#HybridCloud hashtag#CloudNative hashtag#Containers hashtag#PlatformEngineering hashtag#SRE hashtag#CloudComputing hashtag#DeveloperExperience hashtag#CICD hashtag#Istio hashtag#Java hashtag#Cloud hashtag#AWS hashtag#Azure hashtag#infrastructure hashtag#Site hashtag#ArgoCD hashtag#OpenToWork hashtag#C2C hashtag#EngineeringExcellence hashtag#Hiring hashtag#EnterpriseCloud hashtag#AIinProduction hashtag#TechLeadership hashtag#InfrastructureAutomation

Post Content:
Exciting New Chapter Ahead – Open to Full Stack Developer Roles!After an incredible journey working on building scalable applications, leading development teams, and solving complex tech challenges, I’m now looking for my next opportunity as a Full Stack Developer!Over the past four years, I’ve had the chance to work on some amazing projects—transitioning monolithic applications to microservices, optimizing cloud deployments with AWS, and building smooth, user-friendly interfaces with React.js. I thrive in environments where I can tackle backend challenges with Java & Spring Boot while also crafting seamless front-end experiences.At my last role with Folderwave in Boston, I led a team of developers through a large-scale architectural shift, enhancing scalability and doubling feature release velocity. There’s something incredibly fulfilling about seeing a project come to life and knowing you played a key role in making it happen.Now, I’m looking for a new opportunity where I can bring my skills, learn from brilliant minds, and continue pushing the boundaries of what’s possible with technology. If you’re hiring or know of a team that could use an enthusiastic, problem-solving Full Stack Developer, let’s connect!Boston, MA | Open to Remote, Relocation & On-site Roles Tech Stack: Java | Spring Boot | React.js | AWS | Microservices | Docker | KubernetesI’d love to chat—drop me a message or feel free to tag someone who might be interested. "You're spending time to save money when you should be spending money to save time." - 𝗡𝗮𝘃𝗮𝗹 𝗥𝗮𝘃𝗶𝗸𝗮𝗻𝘁*Securing a job in the USA as an international student is no small feat, but it’s entirely possible with the right approach and mindset. The job market is competitive, but you have a unique set of skills and perspectives that can be valuable to employers. By strategically leveraging your resources, networking, and continuously improving your skills, you can position yourself for success.*Remember that job hunting is a process, and it often takes time. Rejections are normal, especially in the beginning. They don’t define your capabilities or your potential. Each step you take brings you closer to your goal. Stay persistent and adapt your approach as you learn more about the industry, the hiring process, and your personal strengths. *The key to success lies in your willingness to invest in yourself—whether it's through networking, learning new skills, or getting professional help with your job applications and interviews. As Naval Ravikant emphasizes, sometimes spending money to save time can accelerate your progress. Whether you invest in career coaching, networking events, or online courses, these investments can give you a competitive edge in a crowded job market.*Lastly, don’t forget to enjoy the process. The journey to securing a job is also an opportunity to learn about different industries, build relationships, and understand your own career goals. Embrace the challenges as they come, and remember that persistence, adaptability, and continuous learning are your best assets.You're not just searching for any job—you're building a foundation for your career in the U.S. Stay focused, stay strategic, and stay confident. The job you’re aiming for is within reach, and your persistence and preparation will make all the difference.Good luck with your job search! "You're spending time to save money when you should be spending money to save time." - 𝗡𝗮𝘃𝗮𝗹 𝗥𝗮𝘃𝗶𝗸𝗮𝗻𝘁*Securing a job in the USA as an international student is no small feat, but it’s entirely possible with the right approach and mindset. The job market is competitive, but you have a unique set of skills and perspectives that can be valuable to employers. By strategically leveraging your resources, networking, and continuously improving your skills, you can position yourself for success.*Remember that job hunting is a process, and it often takes time. Rejections are normal, especially in the beginning. They don’t define your capabilities or your potential. Each step you take brings you closer to your goal. Stay persistent and adapt your approach as you learn more about the industry, the hiring process, and your personal strengths. *The key to success lies in your willingness to invest in yourself—whether it's through networking, learning new skills, or getting professional help with your job applications and interviews. As Naval Ravikant emphasizes, sometimes spending money to save time can accelerate your progress. Whether you invest in career coaching, networking events, or online courses, these investments can give you a competitive edge in a crowded job market.*Lastly, don’t forget to enjoy the process. The journey to securing a job is also an opportunity to learn about different industries, build relationships, and understand your own career goals. Embrace the challenges as they come, and remember that persistence, adaptability, and continuous learning are your best assets.You're not just searching for any job—you're building a foundation for your career in the U.S. Stay focused, stay strategic, and stay confident. The job you’re aiming for is within reach, and your persistence and preparation will make all the difference.Good luck with your job search! "You're spending time to save money when you should be spending money to save time." - 𝗡𝗮𝘃𝗮𝗹 𝗥𝗮𝘃𝗶𝗸𝗮𝗻𝘁*Securing a job in the USA as an international student is no small feat, but it’s entirely possible with the right approach and mindset. The job market is competitive, but you have a unique set of skills and perspectives that can be valuable to employers. By strategically leveraging your resources, networking, and continuously improving your skills, you can position yourself for success.*Remember that job hunting is a process, and it often takes time. Rejections are normal, especially in the beginning. They don’t define your capabilities or your potential. Each step you take brings you closer to your goal. Stay persistent and adapt your approach as you learn more about the industry, the hiring process, and your personal strengths. *The key to success lies in your willingness to invest in yourself—whether it's through networking, learning new skills, or getting professional help with your job applications and interviews. As Naval Ravikant emphasizes, sometimes spending money to save time can accelerate your progress. Whether you invest in career coaching, networking events, or online courses, these investments can give you a competitive edge in a crowded job market.*Lastly, don’t forget to enjoy the process. The journey to securing a job is also an opportunity to learn about different industries, build relationships, and understand your own career goals. Embrace the challenges as they come, and remember that persistence, adaptability, and continuous learning are your best assets.You're not just searching for any job—you're building a foundation for your career in the U.S. Stay focused, stay strategic, and stay confident. The job you’re aiming for is within reach, and your persistence and preparation will make all the difference.Good luck with your job search! "You're spending time to save money when you should be spending money to save time." - 𝗡𝗮𝘃𝗮𝗹 𝗥𝗮𝘃𝗶𝗸𝗮𝗻𝘁*Securing a job in the USA as an international student is no small feat, but it’s entirely possible with the right approach and mindset. The job market is competitive, but you have a unique set of skills and perspectives that can be valuable to employers. By strategically leveraging your resources, networking, and continuously improving your skills, you can position yourself for success.*Remember that job hunting is a process, and it often takes time. Rejections are normal, especially in the beginning. They don’t define your capabilities or your potential. Each step you take brings you closer to your goal. Stay persistent and adapt your approach as you learn more about the industry, the hiring process, and your personal strengths. *The key to success lies in your willingness to invest in yourself—whether it's through networking, learning new skills, or getting professional help with your job applications and interviews. As Naval Ravikant emphasizes, sometimes spending money to save time can accelerate your progress. Whether you invest in career coaching, networking events, or online courses, these investments can give you a competitive edge in a crowded job market.*Lastly, don’t forget to enjoy the process. The journey to securing a job is also an opportunity to learn about different industries, build relationships, and understand your own career goals. Embrace the challenges as they come, and remember that persistence, adaptability, and continuous learning are your best assets.You're not just searching for any job—you're building a foundation for your career in the U.S. Stay focused, stay strategic, and stay confident. The job you’re aiming for is within reach, and your persistence and preparation will make all the difference.Good luck with your job search! 🚀 Why OpenShift Is More Than Just Kubernetes — It’s Enterprise KubernetesKubernetes is powerful, but OpenShift brings the enterprise-grade muscle it needs to run securely, reliably, and at scale.Whether you're modernizing legacy apps, building cloud-native microservices, or implementing hybrid cloud strategies — Red Hat OpenShift is becoming the platform of choice.🔧 What Makes OpenShift Unique?✅ Built-in CI/CD pipelines (Tekton + ArgoCD) ✅ Developer self-service with guardrails ✅ Integrated security – SSO, RBAC, container image scanning ✅ Hybrid & Multi-cloud Ready – AWS, Azure, GCP, VMware, Bare Metal ✅ Operator Framework – Automate Day 2 operations with ease ✅ OpenShift Service Mesh – Built-in observability with Istio, Jaeger, and Kiali🔁 It's not just about containers — it's about lifecycle.From build to deploy to monitor — OpenShift manages the full DevOps lifecycle in a unified, production-ready environment.“Kubernetes is the engine. OpenShift is the vehicle that gets you to production safely.”💡 Are you running OpenShift? Or considering it over vanilla Kubernetes? Drop your experience or questions below — let’s connect and share knowledge! 👇hashtag#OpenShift hashtag#RedHat hashtag#Kubernetes hashtag#DevOps hashtag#HybridCloud hashtag#CloudNative hashtag#Containers hashtag#PlatformEngineering hashtag#SRE hashtag#CloudComputing hashtag#DeveloperExperience hashtag#CICD hashtag#Istio hashtag#Java hashtag#Cloud hashtag#AWS hashtag#Azure hashtag#infrastructure hashtag#Site hashtag#ArgoCD hashtag#OpenToWork hashtag#C2C hashtag#EngineeringExcellence hashtag#Hiring hashtag#EnterpriseCloud hashtag#AIinProduction hashtag#TechLeadership hashtag#InfrastructureAutomation

Exciting New Chapter Ahead – Open to Full Stack Developer Roles!After an incredible journey working on building scalable applications, leading development teams, and solving complex tech challenges, I’m now looking for my next opportunity as a Full Stack Developer!Over the past four years, I’ve had the chance to work on some amazing projects—transitioning monolithic applications to microservices, optimizing cloud deployments with AWS, and building smooth, user-friendly interfaces with React.js. I thrive in environments where I can tackle backend challenges with Java & Spring Boot while also crafting seamless front-end experiences.At my last role with Folderwave in Boston, I led a team of developers through a large-scale architectural shift, enhancing scalability and doubling feature release velocity. There’s something incredibly fulfilling about seeing a project come to life and knowing you played a key role in making it happen.Now, I’m looking for a new opportunity where I can bring my skills, learn from brilliant minds, and continue pushing the boundaries of what’s possible with technology. If you’re hiring or know of a team that could use an enthusiastic, problem-solving Full Stack Developer, let’s connect!Boston, MA | Open to Remote, Relocation & On-site Roles Tech Stack: Java | Spring Boot | React.js | AWS | Microservices | Docker | KubernetesI’d love to chat—drop me a message or feel free to tag someone who might be interested. "You're spending time to save money when you should be spending money to save time." - 𝗡𝗮𝘃𝗮𝗹 𝗥𝗮𝘃𝗶𝗸𝗮𝗻𝘁*Securing a job in the USA as an international student is no small feat, but it’s entirely possible with the right approach and mindset. The job market is competitive, but you have a unique set of skills and perspectives that can be valuable to employers. By strategically leveraging your resources, networking, and continuously improving your skills, you can position yourself for success.*Remember that job hunting is a process, and it often takes time. Rejections are normal, especially in the beginning. They don’t define your capabilities or your potential. Each step you take brings you closer to your goal. Stay persistent and adapt your approach as you learn more about the industry, the hiring process, and your personal strengths. *The key to success lies in your willingness to invest in yourself—whether it's through networking, learning new skills, or getting professional help with your job applications and interviews. As Naval Ravikant emphasizes, sometimes spending money to save time can accelerate your progress. Whether you invest in career coaching, networking events, or online courses, these investments can give you a competitive edge in a crowded job market.*Lastly, don’t forget to enjoy the process. The journey to securing a job is also an opportunity to learn about different industries, build relationships, and understand your own career goals. Embrace the challenges as they come, and remember that persistence, adaptability, and continuous learning are your best assets.You're not just searching for any job—you're building a foundation for your career in the U.S. Stay focused, stay strategic, and stay confident. The job you’re aiming for is within reach, and your persistence and preparation will make all the difference.Good luck with your job search! 🚀 Why OpenShift Is More Than Just Kubernetes — It’s Enterprise KubernetesKubernetes is powerful, but OpenShift brings the enterprise-grade muscle it needs to run securely, reliably, and at scale.Whether you're modernizing legacy apps, building cloud-native microservices, or implementing hybrid cloud strategies — Red Hat OpenShift is becoming the platform of choice.🔧 What Makes OpenShift Unique?✅ Built-in CI/CD pipelines (Tekton + ArgoCD) ✅ Developer self-service with guardrails ✅ Integrated security – SSO, RBAC, container image scanning ✅ Hybrid & Multi-cloud Ready – AWS, Azure, GCP, VMware, Bare Metal ✅ Operator Framework – Automate Day 2 operations with ease ✅ OpenShift Service Mesh – Built-in observability with Istio, Jaeger, and Kiali🔁 It's not just about containers — it's about lifecycle.From build to deploy to monitor — OpenShift manages the full DevOps lifecycle in a unified, production-ready environment.“Kubernetes is the engine. OpenShift is the vehicle that gets you to production safely.”💡 Are you running OpenShift? Or considering it over vanilla Kubernetes? "You're spending time to save money when you should be spending money to save time." - 𝗡𝗮𝘃𝗮𝗹 𝗥𝗮𝘃𝗶𝗸𝗮𝗻𝘁*Securing a job in the USA as an international student is no small feat, but it’s entirely possible with the right approach and mindset. The job market is competitive, but you have a unique set of skills and perspectives that can be valuable to employers. By strategically leveraging your resources, networking, and continuously improving your skills, you can position yourself for success.*Remember that job hunting is a process, and it often takes time. Rejections are normal, especially in the beginning. They don’t define your capabilities or your potential. Each step you take brings you closer to your goal. Stay persistent and adapt your approach as you learn more about the industry, the hiring process, and your personal strengths. *The key to success lies in your willingness to invest in yourself—whether it's through networking, learning new skills, or getting professional help with your job applications and interviews. As Naval Ravikant emphasizes, sometimes spending money to save time can accelerate your progress. Whether you invest in career coaching, networking events, or online courses, these investments can give you a competitive edge in a crowded job market.*Lastly, don’t forget to enjoy the process. The journey to securing a job is also an opportunity to learn about different industries, build relationships, and understand your own career goals. Embrace the challenges as they come, and remember that persistence, adaptability, and continuous learning are your best assets.You're not just searching for any job—you're building a foundation for your career in the U.S. Stay focused, stay strategic, and stay confident. The job you’re aiming for is within reach, and your persistence and preparation will make all the difference.Good luck with your job search! 🚀 Why OpenShift Is More Than Just Kubernetes — It’s Enterprise KubernetesKubernetes is powerful, but OpenShift brings the enterprise-grade muscle it needs to run securely, reliably, and at scale.Whether you're modernizing legacy apps, building cloud-native microservices, or implementing hybrid cloud strategies — Red Hat OpenShift is becoming the platform of choice.🔧 What Makes OpenShift Unique?✅ Built-in CI/CD pipelines (Tekton + ArgoCD) ✅ Developer self-service with guardrails ✅ Integrated security – SSO, RBAC, container image scanning ✅ Hybrid & Multi-cloud Ready – AWS, Azure, GCP, VMware, Bare Metal ✅ Operator Framework – Automate Day 2 operations with ease ✅ OpenShift Service Mesh – Built-in observability with Istio, Jaeger, and Kiali🔁 It's not just about containers — it's about lifecycle.From build to deploy to monitor — OpenShift manages the full DevOps lifecycle in a unified, production-ready environment.“Kubernetes is the engine. "You're spending time to save money when you should be spending money to save time." - 𝗡𝗮𝘃𝗮𝗹 𝗥𝗮𝘃𝗶𝗸𝗮𝗻𝘁*Securing a job in the USA as an international student is no small feat, but it’s entirely possible with the right approach and mindset. The job market is competitive, but you have a unique set of skills and perspectives that can be valuable to employers. By strategically leveraging your resources, networking, and continuously improving your skills, you can position yourself for success.*Remember that job hunting is a process, and it often takes time. Rejections are normal, especially in the beginning. They don’t define your capabilities or your potential. Each step you take brings you closer to your goal. Stay persistent and adapt your approach as you learn more about the industry, the hiring process, and your personal strengths. *The key to success lies in your willingness to invest in yourself—whether it's through networking, learning new skills, or getting professional help with your job applications and interviews. As Naval Ravikant emphasizes, sometimes spending money to save time can accelerate your progress. Whether you invest in career coaching, networking events, or online courses, these investments can give you a competitive edge in a crowded job market.*Lastly, don’t forget to enjoy the process. The journey to securing a job is also an opportunity to learn about different industries, build relationships, and understand your own career goals. Embrace the challenges as they come, and remember that persistence, adaptability, and continuous learning are your best assets.You're not just searching for any job—you're building a foundation for your career in the U.S. Stay focused, stay strategic, and stay confident. The job you’re aiming for is within reach, and your persistence and preparation will make all the difference.Good luck with your job search! "You're spending time to save money when you should be spending money to save time." - 𝗡𝗮𝘃𝗮𝗹 𝗥𝗮𝘃𝗶𝗸𝗮𝗻𝘁*Securing a job in the USA as an international student is no small feat, but it’s entirely possible with the right approach and mindset. The job market is competitive, but you have a unique set of skills and perspectives that can be valuable to employers. By strategically leveraging your resources, networking, and continuously improving your skills, you can position yourself for success.*Remember that job hunting is a process, and it often takes time. Rejections are normal, especially in the beginning. They don’t define your capabilities or your potential. Each step you take brings you closer to your goal. Stay persistent and adapt your approach as you learn more about the industry, the hiring process, and your personal strengths. *The key to success lies in your willingness to invest in yourself—whether it's through networking, learning new skills, or getting professional help with your job applications and interviews. As Naval Ravikant emphasizes, sometimes spending money to save time can accelerate your progress. Whether you invest in career coaching, networking events, or online courses, these investments can give you a competitive edge in a crowded job market.*Lastly, don’t forget to enjoy the process. The journey to securing a job is also an opportunity to learn about different industries, build relationships, and understand your own career goals. Embrace the challenges as they come, and remember that persistence, adaptability, and continuous learning are your best assets.You're not just searching for any job—you're building a foundation for your career in the U.S. Stay focused, stay strategic, and stay confident. The job you’re aiming for is within reach, and your persistence and preparation will make all the difference.Good luck with your job search! Technical Strengths→ Strong mathematics foundation in education→ Exceptional software development skills→ Particularly skilled in Java, Python, and mobile development3. Cost Advantage→ Average developer salary: 30-50% lower than Singapore→ Office space costs: 60-70% lower→ Overall operational savings can reach 40-45%4. Cultural Compatibility→ High work ethic and commitment→ Adaptable to international work environments→ English proficiency improving rapidly in tech sectors5. Challenges to Consider→ Developing soft skills for client-facing roles→ Time needed for cultural integrationMany Singapore companies have already discovered this hidden talent pool while their competitors continue to struggle with local hiring constraints.The most successful ones establish long-term presence rather than just outsourcing.The data shows Vietnam isn't just a backup option - it's becoming a strategic advantage for forward-thinking companies.After helping 200+ Singapore companies build successful tech teams in Vietnam, we've created a comprehensive guidebook.It includes:• Salary benchmarks across all IT rolesDrop a "Vietnam" in the comments, and I'll share the Vietnamese tech talent salary market report with you.P.S. 🚀 Why OpenShift Is More Than Just Kubernetes — It’s Enterprise KubernetesKubernetes is powerful, but OpenShift brings the enterprise-grade muscle it needs to run securely, reliably, and at scale.Whether you're modernizing legacy apps, building cloud-native microservices, or implementing hybrid cloud strategies — Red Hat OpenShift is becoming the platform of choice.🔧 What Makes OpenShift Unique?✅ Built-in CI/CD pipelines (Tekton + ArgoCD) ✅ Developer self-service with guardrails ✅ Integrated security – SSO, RBAC, container image scanning ✅ Hybrid & Multi-cloud Ready – AWS, Azure, GCP, VMware, Bare Metal ✅ Operator Framework – Automate Day 2 operations with ease ✅ OpenShift Service Mesh – Built-in observability with Istio, Jaeger, and Kiali🔁 It's not just about containers — it's about lifecycle.From build to deploy to monitor — OpenShift manages the full DevOps lifecycle in a unified, production-ready environment.“Kubernetes is the engine. OpenShift is the vehicle that gets you to production safely.”💡 Are you running OpenShift? Or considering it over vanilla Kubernetes? "You're spending time to save money when you should be spending money to save time." - 𝗡𝗮𝘃𝗮𝗹 𝗥𝗮𝘃𝗶𝗸𝗮𝗻𝘁*Securing a job in the USA as an international student is no small feat, but it’s entirely possible with the right approach and mindset. The job market is competitive, but you have a unique set of skills and perspectives that can be valuable to employers. By strategically leveraging your resources, networking, and continuously improving your skills, you can position yourself for success.*Remember that job hunting is a process, and it often takes time. Rejections are normal, especially in the beginning. They don’t define your capabilities or your potential. Each step you take brings you closer to your goal. Stay persistent and adapt your approach as you learn more about the industry, the hiring process, and your personal strengths. *The key to success lies in your willingness to invest in yourself—whether it's through networking, learning new skills, or getting professional help with your job applications and interviews. As Naval Ravikant emphasizes, sometimes spending money to save time can accelerate your progress. Whether you invest in career coaching, networking events, or online courses, these investments can give you a competitive edge in a crowded job market.*Lastly, don’t forget to enjoy the process. The journey to securing a job is also an opportunity to learn about different industries, build relationships, and understand your own career goals. Embrace the challenges as they come, and remember that persistence, adaptability, and continuous learning are your best assets.You're not just searching for any job—you're building a foundation for your career in the U.S. Stay focused, stay strategic, and stay confident. The job you’re aiming for is within reach, and your persistence and preparation will make all the difference.Good luck with your job search! 🚀 Why OpenShift Is More Than Just Kubernetes — It’s Enterprise KubernetesKubernetes is powerful, but OpenShift brings the enterprise-grade muscle it needs to run securely, reliably, and at scale.Whether you're modernizing legacy apps, building cloud-native microservices, or implementing hybrid cloud strategies — Red Hat OpenShift is becoming the platform of choice.🔧 What Makes OpenShift Unique?✅ Built-in CI/CD pipelines (Tekton + ArgoCD) ✅ Developer self-service with guardrails ✅ Integrated security – SSO, RBAC, container image scanning ✅ Hybrid & Multi-cloud Ready – AWS, Azure, GCP, VMware, Bare Metal ✅ Operator Framework – Automate Day 2 operations with ease ✅ OpenShift Service Mesh – Built-in observability with Istio, Jaeger, and Kiali🔁 It's not just about containers — it's about lifecycle.From build to deploy to monitor — OpenShift manages the full DevOps lifecycle in a unified, production-ready environment.“Kubernetes is the engine. OpenShift is the vehicle that gets you to production safely.”💡 Are you running OpenShift? Or considering it over vanilla Kubernetes? "You're spending time to save money when you should be spending money to save time." - 𝗡𝗮𝘃𝗮𝗹 𝗥𝗮𝘃𝗶𝗸𝗮𝗻𝘁*Securing a job in the USA as an international student is no small feat, but it’s entirely possible with the right approach and mindset. The job market is competitive, but you have a unique set of skills and perspectives that can be valuable to employers. By strategically leveraging your resources, networking, and continuously improving your skills, you can position yourself for success.*Remember that job hunting is a process, and it often takes time. Rejections are normal, especially in the beginning. They don’t define your capabilities or your potential. Each step you take brings you closer to your goal. Stay persistent and adapt your approach as you learn more about the industry, the hiring process, and your personal strengths. *The key to success lies in your willingness to invest in yourself—whether it's through networking, learning new skills, or getting professional help with your job applications and interviews. As Naval Ravikant emphasizes, sometimes spending money to save time can accelerate your progress. Whether you invest in career coaching, networking events, or online courses, these investments can give you a competitive edge in a crowded job market.*Lastly, don’t forget to enjoy the process. The journey to securing a job is also an opportunity to learn about different industries, build relationships, and understand your own career goals. Embrace the challenges as they come, and remember that persistence, adaptability, and continuous learning are your best assets.You're not just searching for any job—you're building a foundation for your career in the U.S. Stay focused, stay strategic, and stay confident. The job you’re aiming for is within reach, and your persistence and preparation will make all the difference.Good luck with your job search! "You're spending time to save money when you should be spending money to save time." - 𝗡𝗮𝘃𝗮𝗹 𝗥𝗮𝘃𝗶𝗸𝗮𝗻𝘁*Securing a job in the USA as an international student is no small feat, but it’s entirely possible with the right approach and mindset. The job market is competitive, but you have a unique set of skills and perspectives that can be valuable to employers. By strategically leveraging your resources, networking, and continuously improving your skills, you can position yourself for success.*Remember that job hunting is a process, and it often takes time. Rejections are normal, especially in the beginning. They don’t define your capabilities or your potential. Each step you take brings you closer to your goal. Stay persistent and adapt your approach as you learn more about the industry, the hiring process, and your personal strengths. *The key to success lies in your willingness to invest in yourself—whether it's through networking, learning new skills, or getting professional help with your job applications and interviews. As Naval Ravikant emphasizes, sometimes spending money to save time can accelerate your progress. Whether you invest in career coaching, networking events, or online courses, these investments can give you a competitive edge in a crowded job market.*Lastly, don’t forget to enjoy the process. The journey to securing a job is also an opportunity to learn about different industries, build relationships, and understand your own career goals. Embrace the challenges as they come, and remember that persistence, adaptability, and continuous learning are your best assets.You're not just searching for any job—you're building a foundation for your career in the U.S. Stay focused, stay strategic, and stay confident. The job you’re aiming for is within reach, and your persistence and preparation will make all the difference.Good luck with your job search! "You're spending time to save money when you should be spending money to save time." - 𝗡𝗮𝘃𝗮𝗹 𝗥𝗮𝘃𝗶𝗸𝗮𝗻𝘁*Securing a job in the USA as an international student is no small feat, but it’s entirely possible with the right approach and mindset. The job market is competitive, but you have a unique set of skills and perspectives that can be valuable to employers. By strategically leveraging your resources, networking, and continuously improving your skills, you can position yourself for success.*Remember that job hunting is a process, and it often takes time. Rejections are normal, especially in the beginning. They don’t define your capabilities or your potential. Each step you take brings you closer to your goal. Stay persistent and adapt your approach as you learn more about the industry, the hiring process, and your personal strengths. *The key to success lies in your willingness to invest in yourself—whether it's through networking, learning new skills, or getting professional help with your job applications and interviews. As Naval Ravikant emphasizes, sometimes spending money to save time can accelerate your progress. Whether you invest in career coaching, networking events, or online courses, these investments can give you a competitive edge in a crowded job market.*Lastly, don’t forget to enjoy the process. The journey to securing a job is also an opportunity to learn about different industries, build relationships, and understand your own career goals. Embrace the challenges as they come, and remember that persistence, adaptability, and continuous learning are your best assets.You're not just searching for any job—you're building a foundation for your career in the U.S. Stay focused, stay strategic, and stay confident. The job you’re aiming for is within reach, and your persistence and preparation will make all the difference.Good luck with your job search! If you're interested, please share your resume to sameer.kumar@meridianit.com  Job Title: Automation Test Engineer (APi Testing, UI Testing & On-Prem to Azure Cloud Migration) Location: Los Angeles, CA (Onsite) Duration: Long Term Contract  Job Description: We are seeking a skilled Automation Test Engineer with experience in on-prem to Azure cloud migration. The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing, developing, and executing automated test scripts to ensure seamless cloud migration and application stability. This role requires a strong background in test automation frameworks, cloud technologies (Azure), and CI/CD processes.  Key Responsibilities: Design and implement automated test scripts for applications migrating from on-premises to Azure Cloud. Develop and maintain test frameworks using tools like Selenium, Cypress, Playwright, or TestNG. Validate cloud migration activities, ensuring data integrity, performance, and security compliance. Conduct API testing using tools such as Postman, RestAssured, or SoapUI. Perform load, stress, and performance testing to evaluate application behavior post-migration. Work closely with DevOps, development, and cloud teams to integrate testing into CI/CD pipelines. Monitor and analyze test results, identifying defects and working with developers to resolve issues. Ensure adherence to Azure security and compliance standards during testing. Automate infrastructure and environment testing using Terraform, ARM templates, or Azure DevOps. Document test cases, test plans, and generate detailed reports on test execution results.  Required Skills: 10+ years of experience in automation testing. Expertise in test automation tools (Selenium, Cypress, Playwright, TestNG, etc.). Strong knowledge of Azure Cloud services (VMs, Storage, Functions, AKS, etc.). Experience with API testing using Postman, RestAssured, or similar tools. Hands-on experience with CI/CD pipelines (Azure DevOps, Jenkins, GitHub Actions). Knowledge of performance testing using JMeter, LoadRunner, or similar tools. Experience in scripting languages (Python, Java, JavaScript, or C#). Familiarity with containerization tools (Docker, Kubernetes). Understanding of Azure security, networking, and compliance. Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work in an agile environment. hashtag#C2Chashtag#Vendorshashtag#Thirdpartyhashtag#SDETUSAhashtag#LAcandidateshashtag#Resumeshashtag#corptocorphashtag#Jobshashtag#jobhashtag#HiringinLosAngeleshashtag#partners
